think: This is clearly a government body, specifically a local/regional government entity with elected representatives. It is not a company, environmental group, or educational institution, but a democratic governance structure for London.
explanation:
The London Assembly is a devolved regional governance body for Greater London, established in 2000 as part of the Greater London Authority (GLA). It is a public sector entity with 25 elected members responsible for scrutinizing the Mayor of London's activities and holding the mayor accountable. 

Key characteristics:
- Established by the Greater London Authority Act 1999
- Part of local government structure in London
- Serves a strategic administrative role for Greater London
- Conducts public meetings, investigates city issues, and reviews mayoral policies
- Responsible for areas like transport, policing, economic development, and fire services through functional bodies

Sources:
- [Greater London Authority Wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greater_London_Authority)
- [London Assembly official website](https://www.london.gov.uk/who-we-are/what-london-assembly-does)

OPEC (Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries) is an intergovernmental organization of oil-producing countries that works to coordinate and influence the global oil market. Founded in 1960, OPEC currently has 12 member countries that collectively account for approximately 38% of global oil production and 79.5% of the world's proven oil reserves. 

Key characteristics:
- Described as a "cartel" that enables cooperation among leading oil-producing countries
- Aims to collectively influence global oil markets and maximize profit
- Coordinates oil production and pricing strategies among member nations

While not a traditional company, OPEC is fundamentally an organization focused on fossil fuel production and trade, making it clearly a fossil fuel organisation of the type "NGO or trade group".

Source: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OPEC]
